intro: Pycnostachys longiacuminata, commonly known as the long-acuminate pycnostachys, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
